attractions.name: Eiffel Tower
attractions.description: Iconic iron lattice tower offering panoramic views of Paris.

attractions.name: Louvre Museum
attractions.description: Home to the Mona Lisa and one of the world’s largest art collections.

attractions.name: Montmartre
attractions.description: Artistic district with Sacré-Cœur Basilica and street performers.

tips: Buy a Paris Museum Pass to save money and skip lines.
Use the Metro — it's fast and covers all major sites.
Visit the Eiffel Tower at night for the sparkling light show.

1-day: Morning: Louvre → Tuileries → Notre-Dame → Sainte-Chapelle
Evening: Seine River Cruise → Eiffel Tower (night view)
3-day: Day 1: Eiffel Tower → Seine Cruise → Champs-Élysées → Arc de Triomphe
Day 2: Louvre → Montmartre → Sacré-Cœur → Moulin Rouge
Day 3: Palace of Versailles (day trip) → Dinner in Le Marais

attractions.name: Colosseum
attractions.description: Ancient Roman amphitheater that once hosted gladiator battles.

attractions.name: Vatican Museums & Sistine Chapel
attractions.description: World-famous art collection and Michelangelo’s ceiling masterpiece.

attractions.name: Trevi Fountain
attractions.description: Baroque masterpiece where visitors toss coins for good luck.

tips: Book skip-the-line tickets for the Colosseum and Vatican in advance.
Wear comfortable shoes — Rome is best explored on foot.
Tap water is safe and free at public fountains (nasoni).

1-day: Morning: Colosseum → Roman Forum → Capitoline Hill
Afternoon: Trevi Fountain → Pantheon → Piazza Navona → Dinner in Trastevere
3-day: Day 1: Colosseum → Roman Forum → Vatican (St. Peter’s Basilica)
Day 2: Vatican Museums → Sistine Chapel → Castel Sant’Angelo → Tiber River Walk
Day 3: Trastevere food tour → Villa Borghese → Evening gelato at Giolitti

attractions.name: British Museum
attractions.description: Home to the Rosetta Stone and Egyptian mummies.

attractions.name: Tower Bridge & Tower of London
attractions.description: Iconic bridge and historic castle with the Crown Jewels.

attractions.name: West End
attractions.description: Famous theater district with world-class musicals and plays.

tips: Get an Oyster Card for cheap and easy public transport.
Book theater tickets in advance for discounts.
Many museums are free — plan accordingly!

1-day: Morning: Tower Bridge → Tower of London → HMS Belfast
Afternoon: Borough Market → London Eye → Westminster Abbey → Big Ben
3-day: Day 1: British Museum → Covent Garden → West End show
Day 2: Tower Bridge → Tower of London → Shard (view) → Thames River Cruise
Day 3: Buckingham Palace → Hyde Park → Harrods → Camden Market

attractions.name: Sagrada Família
attractions.description: Gaudí’s unfinished masterpiece with stunning stained glass and towers.

attractions.name: Park Güell
attractions.description: Whimsical park with mosaics, sculptures, and panoramic city views.

attractions.name: La Rambla
attractions.description: Famous pedestrian street with street performers and shops.

restaurants.name: Can Culleretes
restaurants.must_try: Pa amb tomàquet with cured ham

tips: Book Sagrada Família tickets online to skip the line.
Avoid eating on La Rambla — overpriced and touristy.
Use the T-Casual metro card for 10 rides.

1-day: Morning: Sagrada Família → Park Güell
Afternoon: Casa Batlló → Passeig de Gràcia → La Rambla → Boqueria Market
3-day: Day 1: Sagrada Família → Park Güell → Gaudí tour
Day 2: Gothic Quarter → Picasso Museum → Barceloneta Beach
Day 3: Montserrat day trip → Tapas dinner in Gràcia

attractions.name: Van Gogh Museum
attractions.description: Largest collection of Van Gogh’s paintings in the world.

attractions.name: Anne Frank House
attractions.description: Hiding place of Anne Frank during WWII — emotional and powerful.

attractions.name: Jordaan District
attractions.description: Charming canalside area with boutiques and cafes.

tips: Book Anne Frank House tickets weeks in advance.
Rent a bike — it’s the best way to explore the city.
Avoid coffee shops selling soft drugs — stick to cafes.

1-day: Morning: Rijksmuseum → Van Gogh Museum
Afternoon: Jordaan → Anne Frank House → Canal Cruise
3-day: Day 1: Museums (Van Gogh, Rijks) → Vondelpark
Day 2: Anne Frank House → Red Light District → Dam Square
Day 3: Zaanse Schans (windmills) → Cheese tasting → Evening in De Pijp

attractions.name: Senso-ji Temple
attractions.description: Tokyo’s oldest temple in Asakusa with a vibrant market street.

attractions.name: Shibuya Crossing
attractions.description: World’s busiest pedestrian scramble.

attractions.name: Meiji Shrine
attractions.description: Peaceful forest shrine dedicated to Emperor Meiji.

tips: Get a Suica card for easy train travel.
Reserve top restaurants in advance.
Avoid rush hour (8–9:30 AM).

1-day: Morning: Meiji Shrine → Harajuku → Shibuya Crossing
Afternoon: Akihabara → Dinner in Shinjuku
3-day: Day 1: Asakusa → Senso-ji → Tokyo Skytree
Day 2: Tsukiji Market → Odaiba → teamLab Planets
Day 3: Imperial Palace → Ueno Park → Golden Gai bars

attractions.name: Grand Palace & Wat Phra Kaew
attractions.description: Stunning royal complex with the Emerald Buddha.

attractions.name: Chatuchak Weekend Market
attractions.description: One of the world’s largest weekend markets with 15,000+ stalls.

attractions.name: Chao Phraya River
attractions.description: Scenic river cruise with stops at major temples.

tips: Dress modestly when visiting temples (cover shoulders and knees).
Use Grab (like Uber) or river boats to avoid traffic.
Drink bottled water only.

1-day: Morning: Grand Palace → Wat Pho (Reclining Buddha)
Afternoon: Damnoen Saduak Floating Market → Dinner at Chinatown
3-day: Day 1: Grand Palace → Wat Pho → Jim Thompson House
Day 2: Chatuchak Market → Siam Paragon → Rooftop bar (Sky Bar)
Day 3: Ayutthaya day trip → Floating market → Thai massage

attractions.name: Gardens by the Bay
attractions.description: Futuristic park with Supertree Grove and Cloud Forest Dome.

attractions.name: Marina Bay Sands
attractions.description: Iconic hotel with infinity pool and panoramic city views.

attractions.name: Sentosa Island
attractions.description: Resort island with Universal Studios and beaches.

tips: Use the EZ-Link card for MRT and buses.
Chewing gum is banned — don’t bring it!
Stay hydrated — it’s hot and humid year-round.

1-day: Morning: Gardens by the Bay → Marina Bay Sands
Afternoon: Chinatown → Clarke Quay → Night Safari
3-day: Day 1: Gardens by the Bay → ArtScience Museum → Merlion Park
Day 2: Sentosa (Universal Studios) → S.E.A. Aquarium
Day 3: Little India → Bugis Street → Jewel Changi (Rain Vortex)

attractions.name: Burj Khalifa
attractions.description: World’s tallest building with breathtaking views from the observation deck.

attractions.name: Dubai Mall
attractions.description: One of the world’s largest malls with aquarium, ice rink, and luxury shops.

attractions.name: Palm Jumeirah
attractions.description: Man-made island with luxury hotels and beaches.

tips: Book Burj Khalifa tickets online for sunset slots.
Dress modestly in public areas.
Tipping is not mandatory but appreciated.

1-day: Morning: Burj Khalifa → Dubai Mall → Aquarium
Evening: Dubai Fountain show → Dhow cruise dinner
3-day: Day 1: Burj Khalifa → Dubai Mall → Souk Madinat
Day 2: Desert safari (dune bashing, camel ride, dinner)
Day 3: Atlantis Aquaventure → Palm Jumeirah → Beach relaxation

attractions.name: Hagia Sophia
attractions.description: Historic Byzantine church turned mosque with massive dome and mosaics.

attractions.name: Blue Mosque
attractions.description: Famous for its blue Iznik tiles and six minarets.

attractions.name: Grand Bazaar
attractions.description: One of the world’s oldest and largest covered markets.

tips: Wear modest clothing when visiting mosques.
Use Istanbulkart for metro, trams, and ferries.
Bargain politely in bazaars.

1-day: Morning: Hagia Sophia → Blue Mosque → Basilica Cistern
Afternoon: Grand Bazaar → Bosphorus ferry ride → Dinner with skyline view
3-day: Day 1: Sultanahmet (Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace)
Day 2: Bosphorus cruise → Ortaköy → Taksim Square → Istiklal Street
Day 3: Spice Bazaar → Suleymaniye Mosque → Turkish bath (hammam)
